newsitem.title: YUGOSLAVIA: ATHLETICS-NDETI FOLLOWS IN BROTHER'S FOOTSTEPS.
newsitem.headline: ATHLETICS-NDETI FOLLOWS IN BROTHER'S FOOTSTEPS.

text.p: Josephat Ndeti followed in the footsteps of his brother Cosmos on Saturday by winning the 10th Belgrade marathon in two hours 13 minutes 37 seconds.
Cosmos Ndeti has won the Boston marathon three times.
"I think I can run 2:06 even 2:05 if necessary, but today I concentrated on winning," Nedti said after defeating fellow-Kenyans Rueben Chebutich and Onesmus Mutisya.
Chebutich clocked 2:13:44 and Mutisya, a cousin of Ndeti, was 18 seconds further back on a sultry day.
